name: milesdonovan
text: Mr. Wheels!

name: deimosrising
text: Considering the fairly frequent interplay between hip hop culture and comic books I find this revelation quite surprising.

name: jthm_guitarist
text: As do I. Ray thinks comic books are childish, but toy trucks are not?

name: tekende
text: Ray thinks comic books are childish, but naming a cart "Mr. Wheels" is not?

name: centipede_damascus
text: Look at him stand in his ROOM!

name: hollis
text: A comment left by hollis was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by unquotable, Creepwood, Darthemed)

name: odei
text: I love the way the line "oh dang I ain't seen Mr. Wheels in basically forever" says so much.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: so much history

name: ssddr
text: Haha teodor has passed out in the last pannel due to the immense shock rendered onto his testes upon impact with the door. Though i'm sure it was lessenend by the fact he is hung like a cranberry

name: soilentshuggah
text: Scree! Scree! Scree! - the all mighty Mr. wheels.

name: phthoggos
text: This is a perfect... strip!

name: dzieger
text: That business in the last three panels would happen to  Showbiz even without a magnet involved.

name: fattypneumonia
text: Damn, you insightful.  Chubbied.

name: greenkoolayd
text: just what in hell do you mean by that?

name: tekende
text: Showbiz is sexually attracted to stereo equipment

name: tommchenry
text: "Oh dang I ain't seen Mr. Wheels in basically forever" is gold. I love pauses in ongoing plots for beautiful turns of dialog like this.

name: drskradley
text: Ah yes.  When you think about it, don't we ALL have a Mr Wheels we haven't seen in basically forever?

name: semiquaver
text: I see you're a Superdickery reader.

name: luckypyjamas
text: i personally enjoy beef peeking through the door at the end

name: jbacardi
text: I'm loving "fetch it and get back here snappity"...

name: biddlebubbly
text: a 22" speaker would sound like straight elephant farts

name: cpnglxynchos
text: what size would a gay one's be?

name: greenkoolayd
text: not that theres anything wrong with that

name: fineoakstructure
text: Heeee-eeeyy!

name: edjarosu
text: I think that last panel is the sort of thing people dream of drawing when they first dip their toe into the world of art.

name: blarghamagarky
text: When I was little we had a pool cleaning device thing that all skimmed across the top of the water and cleaned the sides of the pool and also had tentacles that cleaned the bottom and his name was Oscar

name: blarghamagarky
text: I am saying like everyone has a mr wheels in their life you know

name: unsentletter
text:
My Grandparents' pool clean-y device was named Ambrose.

Now I want to know how it got that name... I'll make a phone call tomorrow.

name: tekende
text: Will that phone call be to today?

name: hedonismbot
text: My parent's pool cleaner was named Manuel.  He glistened.

name: spicyponyhead
text:
The only pool I had access to when I was a child, had a pool cleaner named Mr. Spitter. He had a tail that spat water as his propulsion device, and he'd go around the pool cleaning up. When he reached the top, he'd turn over and go back under, but his tail would poke up and spit water into the air.

Wow, that's not interesting at all.

name: zorglemeister
text: Growing up, I named the pool sweep thingy "Charlie" and the floating chlorine dispenser was "Bob"...  I'm not certain why the names were necessary, or why this disclosure of my 'naming inanimate pool care devices' history was either, oh well, such is the nature of the interweb.

name: i_love_kate
text:
When I was growing up I didn't have a pool because my parents were working class.

True story.

name: soticoto
text: When I was growing up, I didn't have a bath because my mother couldn't afford a house with anything better than a malfunctioning shower... and all the other goth kids would laugh at me.

name: anzio
text: That certainly explains a lot. When I was growing up, I was crazy, so people left me alone after they found out teasing me immediately led to violence.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: the only way i had to clean out the hot tub was a sand bucket. was terrible when all the pine needles were falling into it.

name: grandpayum
text: i would read the krunkman kronicles

name: boredom_man
text: In the past nine months, have you done so?

name: tekende
text: Someone would have to write, draw, and publish it first.

name: sidd2600
text: Man I would be all over reading some Krunkman Kronicles

name: boredom_man
text: In the past eight months, have you figured out that they were Real?

name: tekende
text:
What? Really?

I'ma go check wikipedai. Be right back.

name: tekende
text: You lie. Wikipedia returns nothing. A Google search returns about twelve results, all related to this strip.

name: boredom_man
text: I... don't think I hallucinated it? Please hold while I attempt to determine if this comic book happened or if I at one time believed that it happened.

name: tekende
text: Well? It's been two months.

name: mangtastic
text: Maybe boredom_man was thinking of "Bluntman and Chronic", which bears a passing audial semblance to "Krunkman Kronicles".  I only know of it tangentially, and I believe it is a Kevin Smith thing.  I'm not sure Ray would be into that.

name: sustainability
text: I think I either straight-up hallucinated it or it was a throwaway joke in Zap that I hallucinated into a series. Sorry.

name: dissembly
text: I would like to buy your hallucinations, please. In comic form.

name: sustainability
text: I can't draw, but I will come to your house and scream descriptions of horrible visions at you for a reasonable price.

name: dissembly
text: Wait... i know you. You came into the bookshop i work at just a couple of days ago.

name: sustainability
text: The first time is free. (It is like cocaine.)

name: terribleman
text: For some reason, I'm convinced you are thinking of American Splendor, which is basically real, and where one of the main illustrators' name is Crumb...?

name: sustainability
text: No chance, but whatever I was thinking of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zap_Comix]might have been illustrated by Crumb[/i]. Or I might have completely hallucinated it. Really, the Oracle I'm not.

name: sustainability
text: See? Would the Oracle BBFail like that?

name: madrin
text:
notice how ray becomes distinctively unenlightened with the removal of the cup of mega-water?
comic book references and all that.

name: nyl
text: Ha Ray considers comicbooks childish!! That's rea;;y saying something!!

name: hygraed
text: The 22" speaker coming up to shoulder level on Ray is one of those little things that reminds the reader every so often that the characters are in fact animals.

name: terribleman
text: And that they watch too much Pimp my Ride on MTV...

name: puguglypress
text: I think Ray made Krunkman Kronicles up.

name: greenkoolayd
text: re: the alt text: ray considers comic books childish, yet he will play with a toy truck, just for the hell of it.  im sensing a double standard....

name: stonecrab
text: My feelings on this strip are just so Pro.  Gotta be one of my all time faves.
